entries.title: JPMorgan’s Jamie Dimon had been rebuilding his relationship with the president, serving as a model for other executives, but the fight over Fed chair Powell threatens to topple it.
The Senate voted to kill a war-powers resolution aimed at limiting President Trump’s authority in Venezuela, after the administration assured lawmakers the U.S. has no plans to deploy ground troops
While there is no U.S. aircraft-carrier strike group in the Middle East, officials insist there are sufficient military assets in the region to strike Iran
The U.S. is evacuating some personnel from a base in Qatar as President Trump considers ordering military action in Iran
Top officials from Denmark and Greenland said after a visit to the White House that they hadn’t yet persuaded President Trump to abandon his ambitions to annex Greenland
A divided three-judge panel rejected the Trump administration’s effort to block California’s new congressional map that adds five new Democratic-leaning districts for the 2026 midterm elections
The Nation’s Attic had until Tuesday to send the White House reams of materials about its upcoming shows—or risk losing its federal funding. Now what?
Ford Motor has suspended a worker who heckled President Trump during a tour of a Michigan truck factory on Tuesday
Trump, Growing Impatient, Presses His Prosecutors For Results. Read more in today’s WSJ Politics newsletter:
Nvidia must meet new security requirements before sending its H200 artificial-intelligence chips to China
Wall Street thought it had an ally in Donald Trump. He’s becoming more of an adversary after a series of rapid-fire proposals in the span of a week
Mary Peltola will challenge GOP incumbent Sen. Dan Sullivan in Alaska. She served as the first woman to represent Alaska in the House and the first Alaska Native in Congress
Democrats are entering the 2026 midterm elections with a clear path to reclaiming control of the House, helped by President Trump’s wobbles in his second term, among other factors
Is Greenland next? Read more in today’s WSJ Politics newsletter:
The welfare-fraud scandal that led Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz to abandon his 2026 re-election bid was already public when he was vetted for the 2024 Democratic presidential ticket
Walz Drops Re-Elect Bid As ‘24 Democrats Continue to Fade. Read more in today’s WSJ Politics newsletter:
The State Department will indefinitely pause immigrant visa processing for 75 countries as part of the Trump administration’s effort to block low-income foreigners from immigrating to the U.S.
FBI agents searched the home of a Washington Post reporter Wednesday morning as part of an investigation into mishandling of classified information by a government contractor
As Washington goes on offense against global cyber foes, legislation to foster private-public collaboration will be essential, cybersecurity experts say
The Pentagon said it would invest $1 billion in L3Harris Technologies’ missile business to turbocharge production of rocket and missile components
The Pentagon has told lawmakers that it chose an aircraft painted in civilian colors to carry out a lethal trike on an alleged drug boat because the unit could be the quickest ready for the operation
